intro: Asperula cynanchica subsp. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered asperula, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of East Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in woodland and shaded environments, preferring moist, well-drained soil.
